div.div: Evolution of PIG and TG profiles in 250 year time steps.
div.p: ( A) The unperturbed reference simulation and ( B and C) a mass addition of M = 8000 Gt for two different combinations of rate R and duration T of the perturbation. While the low-rate perturbation ( B) cannot prevent ice sheet collapse, the high-rate perturbation ( C) is sufficient to stabilize the ice sheet (see corresponding white stars in Fig. 4). The two vertical lines indicate the sections of mass addition (asterisks) along the transects. The ice shelf is truncated 25 km downstream of the grounding line for clarity. Locations of cross sections are shown in Fig. 1A.
